intro: Agalmyla sojoliana, commonly known as the golden star cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact, branching structure and is covered in dense, spiny areoles. The plant produces striking yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, adding a vibrant touch to its desert habitat. Its adaptations include thick, fleshy stems that store water, allowing it to survive in harsh, dry conditions. Agalmyla sojoliana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
